botanical_details.genus: Eremurus are herbaceous perennials growing from fleshy roots, with rosettes of strap-shaped basal leaves and a dense racemes of small star-shaped flowers on erect leafless stems

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, free draining soil, in a sunny position with plenty of root space. May need staking in windy sites. Mulch with garden compost in autumn, but avoid covering the crown. Needs winter cold to flower, but protect young spring growth from frost. See eremurus cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed, or by division of mature plants, taking care to minimise root disturbance. Plants grown from seed may vary, and may take 3-5 years to flower. As this plant is protected by Plant Breeders' Rights, any propagation should be for personal rather than commercial use
how_to_grow.pruning: Unless seeds are required, spent flower spikes can be cut down at the base
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs and snails
